title: How to Make Yummy Frozen Popsicles

steps.headline: Go to the fridge and pick out your favorite kind of juice.
steps.description: Orange, cranberry, apple, or lemonade. Any flavor will do.

steps.headline: Take any kind of container that will be easy to remove the popsicles from.
steps.description: Such as a small disposable cup.

steps.headline: Pour the juice into the container.
Take a popsicle stick, toothpick, or straw and stick the in the popsicle.
Put the cup into the freezer.
steps.description: Feel the coldest spot in the fridge. For example: in my fridge, the bottom spot is the coldest and freezes food quicker than the top shelf.

steps.headline: Wait for 2-5 hours for the juice the freeze.
Check on the popsicle every hour.
When it is done, take the popsicle out of the freezer.
Slowly and carefully pull the popsicle out of the container.
If you would like to decorate your popsicle a bit, then you may put an umbrella on the top or whatever you would like.

text: Go to the fridge and pick out your favorite kind of juice. Orange, cranberry, apple, or lemonade. Any flavor will do. Take any kind of container that will be easy to remove the popsicles from. Such as a small disposable cup. Pour the juice into the container. You may choose the amount. Wrap the container with foil/plastic.  Take a popsicle stick, toothpick, or straw and stick the in the popsicle.  Put the cup into the freezer. Feel the coldest spot in the fridge. For example: in my fridge, the bottom spot is the coldest and freezes food quicker than the top shelf. Wait for 2-5 hours for the juice the freeze.  Check on the popsicle every hour.  When it is done, take the popsicle out of the freezer. Remove the foil/plastic. Slowly and carefully pull the popsicle out of the container.  If you would like to decorate your popsicle a bit, then you may put an umbrella on the top or whatever you would like.  Enjoy!
